name: N-(4-ethoxyphenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3468
Reason: 4-ethoxyphenyl and trifluoromethyl functionalities significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant increase due to the electronegativity and rigidity it brings, estimated at around +20 to +30°C. The ethoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 to +20°C. The carbonyl group introduces a strong hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20 to +30°C. The presence of three fluorine atoms increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10 to +20°C each.
